Detailed Description

Definitions and prototypes for the tokenizer/lexer.

Contains definitions and prototypes for the tokenizer/lexer.

Typedef Documentation

gErrorFunc

Type of function pointer for error message setting functions.

Type of function pointer for error message setting functions. The function this points to could also perform logging.

Parameters:
[in] fmt Format string for the message
[in] ... Variable parameters as dictated by the format string.

gGetErrorFunc

Type of function point for getting error messages.

Type used to specify a valid error message function. This function should not take any parameters (in fact, should have a void parameter list) but should return the last error message set by the setError function.

Returns:
last error message set or NULL if setError has not been called.

strCompFunc

Used internally to store either strcmp or stricmp based on flags.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum gParseFlags_e

Tokenizer flags.

Enum containing flag values which can be combined in the flags field of gTokenParms

Enumerator:
gIgnoreCase  Ignore case when marking keywords.
gNewlineTokens  Add a newline token when a newline char is encountered.
gIgnoreUnknowns  Ignore chars that are unknown or unparsable.
gIgnoreEscapes  Do not process escape sequences in string literals eg. "\n".

enum gTokenType_e

Base token types.

This is the starting nub of the token type list. It is a nub in that it is meant to be contined by the program using gParse to include other token types the program might need. When making an enum of custom token types, simply make the first new token type = tLastBaseToken.

Enumerator:
tUnknown  A token that could not be classified.
tIdentifier  Starts with a letter or _ and contains A-Z, a-z, 0-9, and _.
tInteger  Starts with a number and contains only 0-9.
tHexInt  Starts with 0x and contains 0-9, a-f, and A-F.
tDecimal  Starts with either . or 0-9 and contains one . and optionally IEEE formatting stuff...
tString  A quoted string.
tLineBreak  Line end (only generated if gNewlineTokens flag is set).
tEOF  End of file token.
tLastBaseToken  First custom token type.

Function Documentation

void gClearTCache ( gTokenStream *  tokstrm  ) 

Clears the token cache inside a token stream.

Clears the token cache within the stream. All but the very last token cached are freed.

Parameters:
[in] tokstrm Token stream to clear the cache of.

gToken * gCreateToken ( const char *  token,
int  type,
int  linenum,
int  charnum 
)

Creates a token.

Creates and returns a single token struct.

Parameters:
[in] token The actual string contents of the new token
[in] type The token type of the new token.
See also:
gTokenType_e
Parameters:
[in] linenum The line number the token occured on.
[in] charnum The column number the token occured on.
Returns:
A new gToken object with copies of the token string and given info.

gTokenStream * gCreateTokenStream ( gTokenParms *  parms,
gTextStream *  stream,
const char *  name 
)

Creates a token stream.

Creates a new tokenstream from the given parameters. If 'parms' or 'stream' is NULL, the function will not create a new token stream and will return NULL.

Parameters:
[in] parms Parameters the tokenizer/lexer should use for this stream
[in] stream Text stream the tokens should come from.
[in] name The name of the stream (used for error reporting)
Returns:
New token stream.

void gFreeParms ( gTokenParms *  parameters  ) 

Frees a gTokenParms structure.

Frees an allocated gTokenParms structure. Currently this just calls free but it is recommended this function be used.

Parameters:
[in] parameters A pointer to the gTokenParms object to be freed.

void gFreeToken ( void *  object  ) 

Frees a token.

Frees a single token. Changed for use with gList. Use this function to free gToken objects created with gCreateToken.

Parameters:
[in] object The token to be freed.

void gFreeTokenStream ( gTokenStream *  tokstrm  ) 

Frees a token stream made with gCreateTokenStream.

Frees a tokenstream made with gCreateTokenStream. It should be noted this function does NOT free the parms object or the stream. Those need to be freed separately after the stream is freed.

Parameters:
[in] tokstrm The stream to be freed.

gToken * gGetNextToken ( gTokenStream *  tokstrm  ) 

Returns the next token in the stream.

Parses, lexes and returns the next token in the stream. This function does not cache the tokens, so the token this function returns has to be freed manually. It's generally best to avoid this function and use gGetToken.

Parameters:
[in] tokstrm The token stream to get the next token from.
Returns:
Next token in the stream.

gToken * gGetToken ( gTokenStream *  tokstrm,
int  index 
)

Returns a token at the given index in the stream.

Returns the token at the given index. Index must be >= the first token in the streams cache--that is, >= strea->cfirst. If index > stream->clast, the cache of the stream is read-ahead to index. Returns NULL if index was less than cfirst. If not enough tokens could be parsed from the stream to get to index, the last token in the stream is returned (tEOF). This function should NOT be used with the same stream as gGetNextToken.

Parameters:
[in] tokstrm The token stream to get the token from.
[in] index The index within the stream to get the token from.
Returns:
Token at index.

gTokenParms * gNewParms (  ) 

Allocates and initializes and then returns a new gTokenParms structure.

Returns:
A new allocated and initialized gTokenParms object.

void gResetTokenStream ( gTokenStream *  tokstrm  ) 

Resets a token stream.

This function clears all cache and resets the text stream back to the beginning of the file/buffer it is streaming, returning the token stream back to it's initial state.

Parameters:
[in] tokstrm Token stream to be reset.
